places_to_visit.name: Zócalo
places_to_visit.description: The Zócalo, or Plaza Mayor, is the main square in Mexico City and one of the largest city squares in the world. It is surrounded by historic buildings, including the National Palace and the Metropolitan Cathedral.

places_to_visit.name: Chapultepec Park
places_to_visit.description: Chapultepec Park is a large urban park offering various attractions such as the Chapultepec Castle, several museums, and beautiful lakes. It’s a popular spot for picnics, boating, and cultural activities.

places_to_visit.name: Frida Kahlo Museum
places_to_visit.description: The Frida Kahlo Museum, also known as the Blue House, was the former home of the renowned artist. It showcases her life, work, and personal artifacts, offering a deep dive into her creative world.

places_to_visit.name: Teotihuacán
places_to_visit.description: Teotihuacán is an ancient Mesoamerican city known for its monumental pyramids, including the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon. It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site and offers insight into pre-Columbian culture.
